revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-10 21:27:23.000000000', 'message': 'Release openstacksdk for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to openstacksdk since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Change-Id: Icf6c516de55aab47f494391932cf12fab74f463a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Release openstacksdk for stable/train

This release picks up new commits to openstacksdk since
the last release from stable/train.

This is being proposed as a convenience to help make sure stable
changes are being released. If the team is good with this going out,
please respond with a +1 to let the release team know it is OK to
proceed.

If it is not wanted at this time, or if there are more changes that
would be good to get merged before doing a  stable release, please
leave a -1 with a comment with what the team would prefer. We can
then either abandon this patch, or wait for an update with a new
commit hash to use instead.

Change-Id: Icf6c516de55aab47f494391932cf12fab74f463a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add missing security context to Sonobuoy pods/containers

This updates the sonobuoy chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template.

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem flag to true

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740119/

Change-Id: I0964c9809402635c9a7049b61fb954a4ebf01bb1

'}]
commit_message:
[CEPH] Use loopback devices for ceph osds.

- This is to make use of loopback devices for ceph osds since
support for directory backed osds going to depricate.

- Move to bluestore from filestore for ceph-osds.

Change-Id: I49afabdb23355f57a01b209fe9b3383188ab5aaa

subject: Add support for managing generic loopback devices. - Setup loopback devices - Ensure devices are available after reboot - Easy to create generic loopback devices

commit_message:
Add support for managing generic loopback devices.
- Setup loopback devices
- Ensure devices are available after reboot
- Easy to create generic loopback devices

Author: renis makadia <renis.makadia@att.com>

Change-Id: I9238669954ecd5a8a171cc095a94ca88b1fcc160

commit_message:
Elasticsearch - Pod Type Specific Configurations

This change adds the ability to make specific configurations for each
'type' of pod: master, data, client, or gateway

commit_message:
sphinxext: fix warning message for detailed list

Fix the way the warning for undocumented modules in a detail list is
produced. The new importlib.metadata.EntryPoint type is derived from
namedtuple so using string interpolation means the multi-part tuple
causes an error. Take the opportunity to include a more detailed
message.

Change-Id: I02223a982258a1bf8fc28fa91c7c090c7ac3554e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-08 07:32:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't disable SELinux if it is not installed

Kayobe has a role to disable SELinux. Some systems do not have SELinux
installed (this can be reproduced by removing the selinux-policy package
and removing /etc/selinux/config). This causes the selinux
Ansible module to fail, since it can't write to /etc/selinux/config:

    Please install SELinux-policy package, if this package is not
    installed previously.

This change fixes the issue by only disabling SELinux if the config file
exists.

Change-Id: I25c7282c1e8dcdee3e7feddef9d66ca5beeb1bce
Story: 2007704
Task: 39820
(cherry picked from commit 09754df82fdc33d374877991bc73d0dfaf3c412d)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't disable SELinux if it is not installed

Kayobe has a role to disable SELinux. Some systems do not have SELinux
installed (this can be reproduced by removing the selinux-policy package
and removing /etc/selinux/config). This causes the selinux
Ansible module to fail, since it can't write to /etc/selinux/config:

    Please install SELinux-policy package, if this package is not
    installed previously.

This change fixes the issue by only disabling SELinux if the config file
exists.

Change-Id: I25c7282c1e8dcdee3e7feddef9d66ca5beeb1bce
Story: 2007704
Task: 39820
(cherry picked from commit 09754df82fdc33d374877991bc73d0dfaf3c412d)

commit_message:
Don't disable SELinux if it is not installed

Kayobe has a role to disable SELinux. Some systems do not have SELinux
installed (this can be reproduced by removing the selinux-policy package
and removing /etc/selinux/config). This causes the selinux
Ansible module to fail, since it can't write to /etc/selinux/config:

    Please install SELinux-policy package, if this package is not
    installed previously.

This change fixes the issue by only disabling SELinux if the config file
exists.

Change-Id: I25c7282c1e8dcdee3e7feddef9d66ca5beeb1bce
Story: 2007704
Task: 39820
(cherry picked from commit 09754df82fdc33d374877991bc73d0dfaf3c412d)

commit_message:
Remove support for Neutron LBaaS

Neutron LBaaS is not supported in Kolla Ansible since the Train release.
This should have been removed before shipping Kayobe 7.0.0.

Change-Id: I66d3fab2c24ce11cc9996c977ffd13423c7c5794

commit_message:
Enable snapshot tests in the CephFS job

This is only for the Ceph Native job for now,
the new Zuulv3 job for Ceph-NFS will have
snapshot tests enabled when it lands, see [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/726088/

Partially-implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676722/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/736827/
Change-Id: I6fb5a26d8e5c021226f02d496fe086cf345c1cd2
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt

The Vault functional tests are currently failing in the gate, and it
appears to be because the unzip binary is not present. We need to
add it to bindep so it will be installed before running tests.

Change-Id: I4b8075429218a494f75f5e3611f48927d18f1700
Closes-Bug: 1840061
(cherry picked from commit 2547c8c9f8fa76b01aa133c53bc321bc2625668b)

commit_message:
Fix pygments style

New theme of docs (Victoria+) respects pygments_style.
Since we starts using Victoria reqs while being on Ussuri,
this patch ensures proper rendering both in Ussuri and Victoria.

Change-Id: If212755deddefd89baa1da96c0f0f2c2615ffa19

commit_message:
Do not use paramkio transport for delegated tasks

This saves 25s from the previous runtime of 4m21s for
playbooks/lxc-containers-create on an already deployed AIO.

Change-Id: I8b315efed26a22ae669432856eb1e7d994f4ab3
(cherry picked from commit 15ee0011836a30dfeb30c8847b3487a7bb214d5c)

commit_message:
Update jobs

- Increase the number of VM's since we are running two tests.
- Do no run ipa-tempest-wholedisk-* (the partition jobs are covering
this since tempest runs wholedisk and partition tests)
- Remove `partition` from the job names

Change-Id: Ic82fc9dc7b658dab52c06b3619a0118acd111bc5

[{'created': '2020-06-02 19:04:51.000000000', 'message': "Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238

Change-Id: Ia36b422b748a9b06f40a15d74c6b56b508f2a771
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia36b422b748a9b06f40a15d74c6b56b508f2a771

mmm, is there a reason to have this, and not rely on utf8 by default?

I am genuinely curious.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2020-07-09 18:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sorry I got sidetracked with other work and forgot to circle back and fix the tests here. I'll try to do it today or tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2020-07-09 18:16:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> mmm, is there a reason to have this, and not rely on utf8 by
 > default?
 > 
 > I am genuinely curious.

I didn't think that was a safe assumption for all projects that could conceivably use reno. Like what if there was a git repo on windows only that was using the windows character encoding in their files and someone went to use it on linux? Like in the specific case where I I hit this issue the project already asserted all source files and release notes were utf8, but I didn't want to make having that assertion a hard requirement for using reno."}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2020-07-10 14:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-07-10 15:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Looks fine to me.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2020-07-10 17:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-07-13 12:33:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add config option to set default character encoding

This commit adds a new config option 'encoding' which when set will take
a codec string from the stdlib codec library and use it as the encoding
kwarg for all open() calls that are part of the reno commands. This will
let a project assert a specific encoding for all release note files,
which can be important if the project is using special characters and
have contributors using multiple platforms or locales.

Change-Id: If90422fa95cb4eabc4c1722104cef3b28b7fca2d
Story: #2007757
Task: #39959

See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/740596/2 as an alternative'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-07-13 12:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/740596/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-12 16:03:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update sphinxext to work with different EntryPoints

We switched to using importlib.metadata to get EntryPoint information
in I8b08f289d446f4775eac1e1a91997fa96f25f641, and the sphinx extension
was updated to handle the EntryPoints returned by that module.

It appears that projects that use a mix of projects using
importlib.metadata and pkg_resources end up getting a mix of EntryPoint
object types. This was noted in Glance doc builds where this extension
would error due to an EntryPoint not having the "module" property
expected while parsing some taskflow related information.

This adds a helper method to make extracting the module information
more robust. It wasn't enough to just assume one if the other was not
found, so the helper will try a variety of values before defaulting
the the EntryPoint name.

Change-Id: I42448c2089b5c20f8cfe5d31dc26744db76f6d79
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinxext to work with different EntryPoints

We switched to using importlib.metadata to get EntryPoint information
in I8b08f289d446f4775eac1e1a91997fa96f25f641, and the sphinx extension
was updated to handle the EntryPoints returned by that module.

It appears that projects that use a mix of projects using
importlib.metadata and pkg_resources end up getting a mix of EntryPoint
object types. This was noted in Glance doc builds where this extension
would error due to an EntryPoint not having the "module" property
expected while parsing some taskflow related information.

This adds a helper method to make extracting the module information
more robust. It wasn't enough to just assume one if the other was not
found, so the helper will try a variety of values before defaulting
the the EntryPoint name.

Change-Id: I42448c2089b5c20f8cfe5d31dc26744db76f6d79
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add default value in CinderRbdExtraPools task condition

If overrides is empty and CinderRbdExtraPools are specified
(with external ceph clusters), the task that is supposed to
build pools fail.
Adding a default value is safe and avoid this issue.

Change-Id: I7ab85b88f46bb29e4ca9d547ad1743e6e07b0afe
Closes-Bug: #1885258

are your deployments single-node? otherwise i'm not sure how it works."}, {'account_id': 18256, 'date': '2019-10-18 16:22:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-10-23 19:50:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

> are your deployments single-node? otherwise i'm not sure how it
 > works.

No. We are having multi-node deployment but instead of using overlay vxlan tunneling we are using Vlan provider networks for connectivity across different computes"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-10-28 10:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Deepak,

does it work when tap-service and tap-flow are on a separate node?'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-11-11 15:18:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Takashi, first of all, sorry for the late response. I am trying to test it. Right now there is some issue with our ovs-dpdk lab env, as soon as we are able to resolve the lab issues, I'll test and update you. I tested it ok when Tap service and Tao flow are on same compute earlier, but will also test the diff compute scenario and update"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2019-11-13 07:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Deepak,

as far as i know the reference implementation of tap-as-a-service has always assumed tunnel based deployments. i vaguely remember anil had some ideas about non tunnel setups but as far as i know it had never been implemented.

don't take me wrong, i'm not objecting against this patch.
i'm just trying to understand what's expected to work and what isn't."}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-11-14 16:09:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Thanks Takashi for this important update. We didn't suspect anything of this sort and were assuming that the ovs driver must be supporting both kind of deployments. So we never dug deeper into the ovs driver code. However now from the code I see that for all across-the-computes traffic it employs the br-tun. Accordingly TaaS flows are put in br-tun to pass traffic to/from br-tun to/from br-tap and br-int.

I was thinking if we can enhance it in such a way to use br-ex (actual bridge name can be read from the conf, based on the provider network the tap-service/flow ports belong to) and put exactly same flows to that bridge in case the tap-service and tap-flow ports are on provider network? Do you think that will work?

Also can you add Anil to this commit or provide his contact details so that I can understand any potential issues with implementing this support for provider networks in TaaS?"}, {'account_id': 17776, 'date': '2019-11-28 08:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)

some tests please?'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-11-29 10:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-12-02 01:11:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-12-02 01:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-12-02 01:18:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

@Takashi, I have put a new patchset to handle the tunnel-less deployments by using phy-br (br-ex) instead of br-tun and putting taas_id in reg0 to discriminate the mirrored traffic from the normal vlan traffic. Mirrored traffic uses the same vlan as the source port's provider vlan, while taas-id is used to distinguish it from normal traffic on that vlan.

I will try to test this change and let you know the outcome."}, {'account_id': 29963, 'date': '2019-12-02 01:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Build failed.

commit_message:
Support for ovs-dpdk

1. While creating br-tap bridge, pass an additional argument, i.e.
   datapath_type. This parameter is read from openvswitch.ini
   conf file.

2. Add tunneling flows for taas only when tunneling is enabled.

Change-Id: I1520efc10852a5f91403d5637a14cb81a6f5a42c

commit_message:
container_systemd: improve logging

Change the wording when a container will be added to the list of
containers that will be restarted, so it's not confusing.

Change-Id: Ieb50138b5c1d35fa3c59dd368a58c1af3f61807b

So this module is copied here from another repository in order to make it work with ansible versions that do not support collections? In this case just ignore my concern. Not ideal as it gets out-of-sync and we have no way to test changes.

commit_message:
Update podman_container with better idempotency

Add image inspection, idempotency for ulimits, workdir, user,
other image overriden parameters.
Add idempotency for volumes, published ports, others.
Small improvements for docs.
Change-Id: I01011e451827387f70d505242811e896a3a8ad4d

commit_message:
set minion job to nv for now

With the new container builds the container
labels and modify-image-role were not working
correctly together. See related patch
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/740296/

This patch needs to merge and containers need
to be rebuilt, promoted and pushed prior to this
patch being reverted.

Partial-Bug: #1886914
Change-Id: Ia890f78b540113235a07d26f03a626cd1d467b87

commit_message:
tripleo_deploy: improve exceptions catching

If _standalone_deploy returns RC != 0, it'll raise an exception but in
the 'finally' block, we'll still execute things and don't have a final raise to
return.

This is problematic if the "openstack tripleo deploy" is run from
Ansible because the actual return code of the command will be 0 if the
tasks in 'finally' block don't raise.

Change-Id: Ic3e14a02085ae7345a26851a91524d91a5589ec6
Related-Bug: #1886971
Related-Bug: #1886914

commit_message:
Use distinct params for ca cert in nova-vnc-proxy and nova-libvirt

The two services use the same parameter for the location of the
CA cert.  This causes problems when trying to deploy both services
on the same machine, for example in standalone mode.

Change-Id: Ie67bac28ac6097cba810b51496493584be0edcc8

commit_message:
Ensure ssl_ca is always installed to system certs

If an encoded SSL CA cert is provided via configuration ensure
it is installed to the system certificate store.

Add focal to list of default images to sync into glance. This
resolved zaza testing failures and ensures that all LTS releases
of Ubuntu are sync'ed by default.

Change-Id: I58f4b89996dc734c4253c2bc2237616434c8143c
Closes-Bug: 1851474
(cherry picked from commit 2dfcecf8d2fa76654a6f9773dadef2648c4db110)

'}, {'created': '2020-06-19 19:52:31.000000000', 'message': 'Enable cephfs snapshots

The CephFS driver optionally advertised snapshot
support to manila, based on a configuration
option "cephfs_enable_snapshots". Manila does not
provide snapshots by default to users, unless an
administrator chooses to set the "snapshot_support"
extra-spec in the share type they're using. So this
configuration option is really an unnecessary safeguard
at this point.

Moreover, CephFS snapshots are fully supported from
Ceph Nautilus, and with Id847b1b5e6623172f2600afd69e51182067444cb,
manila added a support statement for the Victoria
release that indicates that Nautilus is the minimum
version of ceph supported. So let's default this
option to True, and deprecate this option at the same
time to eliminate this duplicate safeguard.

Partially-implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers
Change-Id: I1ef42b414f8af0b8f9a912655757ec200a75c309
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/676722
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Enable cephfs snapshots

The CephFS driver optionally advertised snapshot
support to manila, based on a configuration
option "cephfs_enable_snapshots". Manila does not
provide snapshots by default to users, unless an
administrator chooses to set the "snapshot_support"
extra-spec in the share type they're using. So this
configuration option is really an unnecessary safeguard
at this point.

Moreover, CephFS snapshots are fully supported from
Ceph Nautilus, and with Id847b1b5e6623172f2600afd69e51182067444cb,
manila added a support statement for the Victoria
release that indicates that Nautilus is the minimum
version of ceph supported. So let's default this
option to True, and deprecate this option at the same
time to eliminate this duplicate safeguard.

Partially-implements: bp update-cephfs-drivers
Depends-On: I885ff78586540d01590f98cca2a00d55161dbe04
Change-Id: I1ef42b414f8af0b8f9a912655757ec200a75c309
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 08:49:07.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use admin credentials when removing DNS records

This resolves a bug that causes stale records to be kept in place when
an admin deletes a server that was created by some other project.

Note 1: I'm not sure that this is the correct solution, the likely
better option would be to check whether the current session credentials
are admin creds and then add the all_projects flag conditionally.

Note 2: If we were to implement this solution, we would need to make the
designate user have admin rights, because otherwise the all_projects
option is not valid.

Change-Id: I7cbb0e87a7e87f23ccf5d8750835b4785693473a
Closes-Bug: #1875981

commit_message:
Optionally use admin powers when deleting DNS records

This resolves a bug that causes stale records to be kept in place when
an admin deletes a port, server or floating IP that was created in some
project other than the admin project.

Change-Id: I7cbb0e87a7e87f23ccf5d8750835b4785693473a

commit_message:
Add --yes into update commands to autoconfirm.

In [0] a confirmation flag has been included for the updates
procedure to ensure customers are aware of the type of operation
they are about to perform.

We need the --yes flag in tripleo-upgrade so the execution doesn't
get waiting for the user to type yes. This patch will check in the
command's help if the --yes option is available, if so it will
include it in the command execution.

Co-Authored-By: Sergii Golovatouk <sgolovat@redhat.com>

[0] - I838e6748879c668dd004ca2243b7b00b857c2a7b

Change-Id: Ibb0676e7a3d97645e4e8a2553e7ec175e96a14b4

[{'created': '2020-07-13 06:04:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add a migration that deletes redundant delayed calls

* Due to the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1861988
  some Mistral installations may have redundant delayed calls with
  the empty "key" column. This patch adds a DB migration that cleans
  them up.

Change-Id: Ic46d3d711a03fbd6364809a0fddcbb48f3e28d2a
Closes-Bug: #1887335
'}]
commit_message:
Add a migration that deletes redundant delayed calls

* Due to the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1861988
  some Mistral installations may have redundant delayed calls with
  the empty "key" column. This patch adds a DB migration that cleans
  them up.

Change-Id: Ic46d3d711a03fbd6364809a0fddcbb48f3e28d2a
Closes-Bug: #1887335

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-05 12:58:17.000000000', 'message': "Correct reported system memory

In Python 3.3+, 'sys.platform' no longer includes a major version [1]:

  issue 12326: On Linux, sys.platform doesn't contain the major version
  anymore. It is now always 'linux', instead of 'linux2' or 'linux3'
  depending on the Linux version used to build Python. Replace
  sys.platform == 'linux2' with sys.platform.startswith('linux'), or
  directly sys.platform == 'linux' if you don't need to support older
  Python versions.

Since we only care about Python 3.6 or greater, we could simply check
for 'linux'. However, the libvirt driver isn't supported on non-Linux
hosts so this was always a dumb check. Simply remove it instead.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.3/whatsnew/3.3.html#porting-python-code

Change-Id: I207a6c8c8cf562477792c69e353ba99b3ec4cb5e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1882233

hosts so this was always a dumb check. Simply remove it instead.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.3/whatsnew/3.3.html#porting-python-code

Change-Id: I207a6c8c8cf562477792c69e353ba99b3ec4cb5e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1882233
"}]
commit_message:
Correct reported system memory

In Python 3.3+, 'sys.platform' no longer includes a major version [1]:

  issue 12326: On Linux, sys.platform doesn't contain the major version
  anymore. It is now always 'linux', instead of 'linux2' or 'linux3'
  depending on the Linux version used to build Python. Replace
  sys.platform == 'linux2' with sys.platform.startswith('linux'), or
  directly sys.platform == 'linux' if you don't need to support older
  Python versions.

Since we only care about Python 3.6 or greater, we could simply check
for 'linux'. However, the libvirt driver isn't supported on non-Linux
hosts so this was always a dumb check. Simply remove it instead.

[1] https://docs.python.org/3.3/whatsnew/3.3.html#porting-python-code

Change-Id: I207a6c8c8cf562477792c69e353ba99b3ec4cb5e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1882233

commit_message:
Fix pep8 and functional jobs

New versions of isort broke pylint. This patch fixes it at 4.3.21.

The functional job fails because of bugfixes that happened in
neutron. We need to update our functional jobs also.

Closes-Bug: #1887363

Change-Id: Ied00100774866f1703acd502f4885d456d887d82

commit_message:
add tempest boot_mode config

This patches update the devstack to automatically
set the new tempest configuration `boot_mode`,
it will use the value from IRONIC_BOOT_MODE variable.

Increase the number of VM's in ironic-tempest-ipa-partition-pxe_ipmitool,
ironic-tempest-ipa-wholedisk-bios-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa and
ironic-tempest-ipa-partition-redfish-tinyipa
to 2 since it runs cleanning and now we run two tempest tests.

Conflicts:
       devstack/lib/ironic
       zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: Ic6faf73430e56e2b1ff19a72b1b03f8ef34eff5f
(cherry picked from commit ddbc4a6a099da83701aad67386e8f1e1646ee80d)

commit_message:
Use command to set pythonintepreter

This commit cherrypick from commit
369396d7ccbf9c1bf1bfb5b9974c26c15025b434 plus additional similiar
change in ipaservices-baremetal-ansible.yaml.

PythonInterpreter takes string value and let's use
$(command -v python3 || command -v python) to find
the interpreter value and it does not break existing user
interface also.

Closes-Bug: 1887146
Change-Id: Ia9c22c535f9a411ec2024ed5a1db911bf85dbf61
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 369396d7ccbf9c1bf1bfb5b9974c26c15025b434)

commit_message:
Add some volumes to make omsa work in sensu

This maps the unix sockets that omsa creates from the system OS
into the sensu container so that hardware monitoring actually
works.

Change-Id: Ic3de993bbbd441fdc7e790a183612c2a951c38fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-17 11:38:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix building sensu-client by pinning network-checks version

We cannot rely on any versios of network-checks ~>2.
Sensu plugin network-checks of 2.0.0<VERSION,3.0.0 had runtime
dependency "whois>=4.0.0" [1] that results in installing whois >= 5
which requires ruby>2 (doesn't exist at Centos host) that conflicts with
first condition of [2] and fails the build.

[1] - https://github.com/sensu-plugins/sensu-plugins-network-checks/blob/2.3.1/sensu-plugins-network-checks.gemspec#L36
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/9.0.0.0rc2/docker/sensu/sensu-client/Dockerfile.j2#L93

Change-Id: I4d2a6136e4c4501e9f16a145b616fbea0530a966
'}]
commit_message:
Fix building sensu-client by pinning network-checks version

We cannot rely on any versios of network-checks ~>2.
Sensu plugin network-checks of 2.0.0<VERSION,3.0.0 had runtime
dependency "whois>=4.0.0" [1] that results in installing whois >= 5
which requires ruby>2 (doesn't exist at Centos host) that conflicts with
first condition of [2] and fails the build.

[1] - https://github.com/sensu-plugins/sensu-plugins-network-checks/blob/2.3.1/sensu-plugins-network-checks.gemspec#L36
[2] - https://github.com/openstack/kolla/blob/9.0.0.0rc2/docker/sensu/sensu-client/Dockerfile.j2#L93

Change-Id: I4d2a6136e4c4501e9f16a145b616fbea0530a966

commit_message:
Add initial Sensu Docker support

Sensu is a monitoring tool that will be able to monitor the
infra' deployed by kolla.

This change adds an initial Sensu Docker image, but will
likely need additional changes as other components are
integrated with it.

The ansible support will be submitted separately.

Change-Id: Iee5a684e17716821ca5e668c057a7840b9f63411
Partially-implements: bp sensu
Signed-off-by: Dave Walker (Daviey) <email@daviey.com>

commit_message:
Adding ODL source install for kolla.

These changes will implement source install option and can installs ODL
from latest snapshot .tar.gz built by ODL project. Requires type url
and the location of the .tar.gz for ODL in kolla-build.conf file.
Starts the ODL server when the container runs.

Change-Id: I937661a5c531eec35c87b37627a088a4f9046db5
Signed-off-by: Manjunath Ranganathaiah <manjunath.ranganathaiah@intel.com>

commit_message:
Always clear cached facts first

Because you could be running against different clouds or hosts, we need
to always clear the facts at the start of the deployment playbook to
ensure we aren't using incorrectly cached facts. That being said, the
caching mechanism should persist between the plays in the overall
deployment.

Change-Id: I5992edf43bf1995eebdf401c6bd886e77e528695
Closes-Bug: #1884654
(cherry picked from commit 1f9942fd755a168f8a9b75afa09e8af7027d61d4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-08 10:10:51.000000000', 'message': "Load br_netfilter module in nova-cell role

The nova-cell role sets the following sysctls on compute hosts, which
require the br_netfilter kernel module to be loaded:

    net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables
    net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables

If it is not loaded, then we see the following errors:

    Failed to reload sysctl:
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables: No such file or directory
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-ip6tables: No such file or directory

Loading the br_netfilter module resolves this issue.

Typically we do not see this since installing Docker and configuring it
to manage iptables rules causes the br_netfilter module to be loaded.
There are good reasons [1] to disable Docker's iptables management
however, in which case we are likely to hit this issue.

This change loads the br_netfilter module in the nova-cell role for
compute hosts.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1849275

Co-Authored-By: Dincer Celik <hello@dincercelik.com>

Change-Id: Id52668ba8dab460ad4c33fad430fc8611e70825e
"}, {'created': '2020-07-08 10:14:00.000000000', 'message': "Load br_netfilter module in nova-cell role

require the br_netfilter kernel module to be loaded:

    net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables

If it is not loaded, then we see the following errors:

    Failed to reload sysctl:
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables: No such file or directory
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-ip6tables: No such file or directory

Loading the br_netfilter module resolves this issue.

Typically we do not see this since installing Docker and configuring it
to manage iptables rules causes the br_netfilter module to be loaded.
There are good reasons [1] to disable Docker's iptables management
however, in which case we are likely to hit this issue.

This change loads the br_netfilter module in the nova-cell role for
compute hosts.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1849275

Co-Authored-By: Dincer Celik <hello@dincercelik.com>

Change-Id: Id52668ba8dab460ad4c33fad430fc8611e70825e
"}]
commit_message:
Load br_netfilter module in nova-cell role

The nova-cell role sets the following sysctls on compute hosts, which
require the br_netfilter kernel module to be loaded:

    net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables
    net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables

If it is not loaded, then we see the following errors:

    Failed to reload sysctl:
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-iptables: No such file or directory
    sysctl: cannot stat /proc/sys/net/bridge/bridge-nf-call-ip6tables: No such file or directory

Loading the br_netfilter module resolves this issue.

Typically we do not see this since installing Docker and configuring it
to manage iptables rules causes the br_netfilter module to be loaded.
There are good reasons [1] to disable Docker's iptables management
however, in which case we are likely to hit this issue.

This change loads the br_netfilter module in the nova-cell role for
compute hosts.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1849275

Co-Authored-By: Dincer Celik <hello@dincercelik.com>

Change-Id: Id52668ba8dab460ad4c33fad430fc8611e70825e

commit_message:
Remove ffwd-upgrade commands from tripleoclient.

Now that the FFU process relies on the openstack overcloud upgrade
commands there is no need to keep the old ffwd-upgrade command
available.

This patch removes the three ffwd-upgrade (run, prepare and converge)
as well as their tests, utils functions and constants.

Change-Id: If0c0ed9a44a51cf367fd060c77e10055f367694c

commit_message:
Remove --update-plan-only from UPGRADE converge.

In [0] the default behavior for the upgrade converge is
running only an stack update, not a full re-deployment.
Therefore, there is no need for the flag tripleo_upgrade
_converge_plan_only any more.

[0] - I6148511eb6ad1e3798a7bf40c721824830c7073d
Depends-On: I6148511eb6ad1e3798a7bf40c721824830c7073d
Change-Id: I3de53d49cc8dc7dab6898c784fd264d1aef3a3d0

commit_message:
Evaluate PASSWORDS_FILE later

Currently seting --configdir on kolla-ansible CLI doesn't set properly the path
for the passwords file.

Change-Id: I38d215b721ec256be6cfdd6313b5ffb90c2a3f4c
Closes-Bug: #1887180
Co-Authored-By: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN] Devstack: Apply changes suggested by DevStack cores

This patch addresses the changes suggested at [0], the reason to put
this in Neutron first is to test if all the jobs works as expected with
the changes given that the devstack gate has only one job running
with OVN for now.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734621/

Change-Id: I16f02d7de21b623bb206e32b1226ea16eb7c5867
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1862633

If port update fails during unshelve of an offloaded server then
placement allocation on the target host is leaked.

Changes in nova test_bug_1862633.py due to
I2cf2fcbaebc706f897ce5dfbff47d32117064f9c is missing from stable/queens

Change-Id: I7be32e4fc2e69f805535e0a437931516f491e5cb
Related-Bug: #1862633
(cherry picked from commit c33ebdafbd633578a0a4b6f1b118c756510acea6)
(cherry picked from commit bd1bfc13d7e2c418afc409871ab56da454a1334d)
(cherry picked from commit f960d1751d752d559ea18604bfd1fcaf1a3283cd)
(cherry picked from commit 5e452f8eb743c226af4f4998835ece8dd142a011)

"}, {'created': '2020-07-06 16:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Fix bind mount volumes for novajoin containers

/var/lib/config-data/novajoin should not be bind mounted directly.
The way it works, is that a step 1 we generate all the config files with
Puppet and put the /etc/novajoin content into
/var/lib/config-data/novajoin and then filter out that is actually
needed by the containers into
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin.

/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin will have
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin/etc/novajoin with the
config files but it won't have the files excluded by container-puppet.sh
(e.g. host files, some CA/PKI files, etc).

In the container configs, we want to bind mount
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin into
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src
and when the container will start, Kolla will automatically copy the
content of
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src
into / by deep merging; so /etc/novajoin will have the config files.

Closes-Bug: #1886047
Resolves: rhbz#1853268

Change-Id: I9d28b5f7f40d43e017153cb274a3f419e23511c3
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bind mount volumes for novajoin containers

/var/lib/config-data/novajoin should not be bind mounted directly.
The way it works, is that a step 1 we generate all the config files with
Puppet and put the /etc/novajoin content into
/var/lib/config-data/novajoin and then filter out that is actually
needed by the containers into
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin.

/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin will have
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin/etc/novajoin with the
config files but it won't have the files excluded by container-puppet.sh
(e.g. host files, some CA/PKI files, etc).

In the container configs, we want to bind mount
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin into
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src
and when the container will start, Kolla will automatically copy the
content of
/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/novajoin:/var/lib/kolla/config_files/src
into / by deep merging; so /etc/novajoin will have the config files.

Closes-Bug: #1886047
Resolves: rhbz#1853268

Change-Id: I9d28b5f7f40d43e017153cb274a3f419e23511c3

commit_message:
change segment id type to int

the type of network.get('provider:segmentation_id') is int, rather than
string, so when segmenttation_id is not given, set default value to
1(not '1')

Change-Id: I1d09a5616ebc305454a0b2e29d3dcb6b349688b9

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Note that https://github.com/openstack/charms.openstack is used during tests
and he need `mock`, unfortunatelly it doesn't declare `mock` in its
requirements so it retrieve mock from other charm project (cross dependency).
So we depend on charms.openstack first and when
Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142 will be merged then CI
will pass without errors.

Depends-On: Ib1ed5b598a52375e29e247db9ab4786df5b6d142
Change-Id: Ibddd954daaf3cd008985ff27cd95dfe649476555

Improve README

This improvement is part of a wave of polish
in preparation for the launch of the Ceph product.

Add Configuration, Actions, and Bugs sections.

In config.yaml, modernise example values for 'source'
and use consistent words with the ceph-osd, ceph-mon,
and ceph-fs charms.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]

Change-Id: Ic1c5dfa969941b8d7a88dfc6586d1046d0fdd33f
"}]
commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ic1c5dfa969941b8d7a88dfc6586d1046d0fdd33f

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Note that https://github.com/openstack/charms.openstack is used during tests
and he need `mock`, unfortunatelly it doesn't declare `mock` in its
requirements so it retrieve mock from other charm project (cross dependency).

commit_message:
Make the rbd pool name configurable

Allow the rbd pool name to be set via config. This brings glance
inline with other openstack ceph clients such as cinder.

Change-Id: I93b28c1b1276cca73348fd421024ef3ce0241258

subject: Use unit-name from interface if provided
messages: [{'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2020-07-11 08:52:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-07-13 05:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-11 08:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use unit-name from interface if provided

If the interface provides a remote unit name then use it otherwise
fallback to using juju env. The interface will provide a CMR safe
unit name *1 if possible so use it.

*1 https://github.com/openstack-charmers/charm-interface-vault-kv/pull/11

Change-Id: Ib17e826054b5831099312166d921afa23adc8a2b
'}]
commit_message:
Use unit-name from interface if provided

If the interface provides a remote unit name then use it otherwise
fallback to using juju env. The interface will provide a CMR safe
unit name *1 if possible so use it.

*1 https://github.com/openstack-charmers/charm-interface-vault-kv/pull/11

Change-Id: Ib17e826054b5831099312166d921afa23adc8a2b

messages: [{'account_id': 21107, 'date': '2020-07-07 06:22:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-07-13 05:39:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nAs the original author behind this change (glance/glance-store had a really bad default (8 bytes vs than 8K) which was subsequently fixed so happy to drop this.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-07 06:22:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove rbd_store_chunk_size=8 reverting to default

We have shipped rbd_store_chunk_size=8 in our glance configuration for a
very long time, this value was sometimes suggested in older upstream
documentation and has the effect of halving the number of rados objects
used to store glance images.

When using qcow2 images in ceph the created VM volume will have an
rbd_store_chunk_size=4 (the default) however in modern clouds when
images are in the raw format we will use copy-on-write cloning from the
image to the volume, which means all such VM volumes inherit
rbd_store_chunk_size=8 from the parent. This has negative performance
implications for working volumes as there are object-wide locks that now
cover twice as much data and a wider chunk of sequential disk storage
will hit the same OSD.

Any overhead benefit of using objects only double the size (and thus
half in number) is very likely long relegated to history given the
number of volumes we're likely to have in a cloud versus base images, so
there doesn't seem to be any benefit to this setting and outside of a
few glance documents this rbd option is not documented anywhere I can
find as a suggestion or with any evidence of an advantage of performance
improvement from storing images this way.

Remove rbd_store_chunk_size=8 from all configuration files so that it
reverts to the default of 4.

Existing images (and old or new dependent volumes of them) will maintain
the existing rbd_store_chunk_size=8 and continue to work correctly. New
images will be created with the new rbd_store_chunk_size=4.

Change-Id: I5f6801c418430bbdcda53b94fcd51ed2fc230b68
"}]
commit_message:
Remove rbd_store_chunk_size=8 reverting to default

We have shipped rbd_store_chunk_size=8 in our glance configuration for a
very long time, this value was sometimes suggested in older upstream
documentation and has the effect of halving the number of rados objects
used to store glance images.

When using qcow2 images in ceph the created VM volume will have an
rbd_store_chunk_size=4 (the default) however in modern clouds when
images are in the raw format we will use copy-on-write cloning from the
image to the volume, which means all such VM volumes inherit
rbd_store_chunk_size=8 from the parent. This has negative performance
implications for working volumes as there are object-wide locks that now
cover twice as much data and a wider chunk of sequential disk storage
will hit the same OSD.

Any overhead benefit of using objects only double the size (and thus
half in number) is very likely long relegated to history given the
number of volumes we're likely to have in a cloud versus base images, so
there doesn't seem to be any benefit to this setting and outside of a
few glance documents this rbd option is not documented anywhere I can
find as a suggestion or with any evidence of an advantage of performance
improvement from storing images this way.

Remove rbd_store_chunk_size=8 from all configuration files so that it
reverts to the default of 4.

Existing images (and old or new dependent volumes of them) will maintain
the existing rbd_store_chunk_size=8 and continue to work correctly. New
images will be created with the new rbd_store_chunk_size=4.

Change-Id: I5f6801c418430bbdcda53b94fcd51ed2fc230b68

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I2d545d7001f5879d86c78c19e391b7828d1172b7

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Iaf0edaa9d520923d15d0d897b0084f6b7a2cf10a

commit_message:
Use relative name for class inclusion

This patch replces the remaining usage of absolute name in 'require',
and makes all class inclusion depend on relative name.

Change-Id: Ic4698d309e899303c7e2566187fb21a442fb930d

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: I5d8e1d2320d75340fb802b4ef6a4f2a8fcafc8cd

[{'created': '2020-07-12 03:17:50.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I930a119326d26295c57b3bf1fd01ac9c1793c554

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 9257, 'name': 'John Eckersberg', 'email': 'jeckersb@redhat.com', 'username': 'jeckersb'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-07-07 13:36:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/ussuri.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-07-07 13:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit f08b9164c7351bca811de2bc5fb153285d1f5b9c'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-07-07 13:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-07-11 17:19:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-07-13 01:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-07 13:36:14.000000000', 'message': 'Don't set RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS

From the RabbitMQ docs[1]:

"RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS - Standard parameters for the erl command
used when invoking the RabbitMQ Server. This should be overridden for
debugging purposes only. Overriding this variable replaces the default
value."

We do not need any of the current values because of this commit from
2015 in rabbitmq 3.5.4:

https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/commit/5c3c0e6f38792ca37289888ce39996e6baf4d846

In which the "+K true" and "-kernel inet_default_connect_options
"[{nodelay,true}]" options were hard-coded to the rabbitmq-server
script.  Meanwhile the "+P 1048576" configuration was moved to the
rabbitmq-env script under the SERVER_ERL_ARGS variable, which is the
defaults used when RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS is unset.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/configure.html#supported-environment-variables

Let's also move the current RabbitAdditionalErlArgs to a new dedicated
override hiera key.

NB: To get this properly working we need a puppet-rabbitmq that contains
    https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/841
Depends-On: I3bf244a70538209773804eb85fae6be035c587f4

Closes-Bug: #1884922

Change-Id: I567839785a72813a382a00253562894e19eb6715
(cherry picked from commit 938166b93b8fc525d575c53509f8364a8f3d04e5)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't set RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS

From the RabbitMQ docs[1]:

"RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS - Standard parameters for the erl command
used when invoking the RabbitMQ Server. This should be overridden for
debugging purposes only. Overriding this variable replaces the default
value."

We do not need any of the current values because of this commit from
2015 in rabbitmq 3.5.4:

https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/commit/5c3c0e6f38792ca37289888ce39996e6baf4d846

In which the "+K true" and "-kernel inet_default_connect_options
"[{nodelay,true}]" options were hard-coded to the rabbitmq-server
script.  Meanwhile the "+P 1048576" configuration was moved to the
rabbitmq-env script under the SERVER_ERL_ARGS variable, which is the
defaults used when RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS is unset.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/configure.html#supported-environment-variables

Let's also move the current RabbitAdditionalErlArgs to a new dedicated
override hiera key.

NB: To get this properly working we need a puppet-rabbitmq that contains
    https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/841
Depends-On: I3bf244a70538209773804eb85fae6be035c587f4

Closes-Bug: #1884922

Change-Id: I567839785a72813a382a00253562894e19eb6715
(cherry picked from commit 938166b93b8fc525d575c53509f8364a8f3d04e5)

commit_message:
Unmount NFS shares before launching LEAPP

There is an inhibitor which will stop upgrade if there are NFS shares
mounted.

Change-Id: Ifb44c70e8becc94453b0c086858985d76b2455a6
Closes-Bug: 1884926

messages: [{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-07-07 03:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-07-07 07:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-07-07 08:54:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-07-13 01:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-07 03:12:39.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I870286a2557e41099597c22dc9747743e1077615
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from unittest2 compat methods to Python 3.x methods

With the removal of Python 2.x we can remove the unittest2 compat
wrappers and switch to assertCountEqual instead of assertItemsEqual

We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I870286a2557e41099597c22dc9747743e1077615

commit_message:
Nuage: remove check on mechanism driver

Nuage neutron integration has a collection of mechanism
drivers sharing same configuration. This patchset removes check
on nuage ml2 mechanism driver which is not mandatory anymore.

Change-Id: Id6e609d0a556e23c484f38f4651d2709d898a76c
(cherry picked from commit 9fc323f48a466dfb5bc64c048a67ce878599ff2f)

[{'created': '2020-03-24 16:07:43.000000000', 'message': 'Make the metalsmith module interactions more resilient

This change adds retries around the metalsmith module interactions.
These retries will ensure greater degrees of success when dealing with
potentially flaky API calls.

Change-Id: Ibc5d34f5322340e91163830426fa400c990c48f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Make the metalsmith module interactions more resilient

This change adds retries around the metalsmith module interactions.
These retries will ensure greater degrees of success when dealing with
potentially flaky API calls.

Change-Id: Ibc5d34f5322340e91163830426fa400c990c48f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Init HostState.failed_builds

If _update_from_compute_node returns early and the HostState is
not filtered out we can hit an AttributeError in the
BuildFailureWeigher because the failed_builds attribute is not
set. This simply initializes the attribute like the other stats
fields.

Change-Id: I5f8e4d32c6a1d6b61396b4fa11c5d776f432df0c
Closes-Bug: #1834691
(cherry picked from commit d540903463aa9b0cf69cefac7cc60e5b70e40a1c)
(cherry picked from commit 725b37f515e4ad01e1f4491b6d8137ce1416f6d6)
(cherry picked from commit 5acbea506a137492511a762e454d785810365bd8)
(cherry picked from commit 9bc95675325498a7d30b67089e19b5b953d77e75)

commit_message:
Uses novaclient instead of troveclient

The list of flavors doesn't appear when creating a database instance,
but users should be able to select a flavor when they create a database
instance because they need to obtain a flavor that works for a database.
In addition, they can select a flavor in creating a database instance
when using openstack cli.

Change-Id: I0fda70a57671536cdbc0ed82a10634ebfa2a7f62
Story: 2007842
Task: 40132

Or it's enough to protect in pollster?"}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-07-01 11:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Code-Review

> I am a little question. If exception protection is added here, is
 > it necessary for other place where libvirt is called?
 > Or it's enough to protect in pollster?

In theory, we already have the "@libvirt_utils.retry_on_disconnect", which would retry on connection errors. Therefore, so far, for the problem reported, the try/catch here would be enough.'}, {'account_id': 28356, 'date': '2020-07-01 11:42:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-07-01 21:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-07-01 21:10:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2020-07-03 05:25:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Hello Lingxian and Erlon,

This message will be always output if live-migration is running when ceilometer works.
But it is normal as the commit message says.

> It raises error even when live migration.
> As live migration uses lock normally, it should not be an error.

So I think operator's attention is not required for this."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-07-04 11:17:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

> So I think operator's attention is not required for this.

In the message it said 'This may not be harmful, but please check', why and what the operator should check if it's even not a warning?"}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2020-07-08 08:45:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hi Lingxian,

I could understand your opinion. I take back my comments.
I agree to change the log level to warning.'}, {'account_id': 5112, 'date': '2020-07-10 04:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 4264, 'date': '2020-07-10 06:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-07-12 06:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

thanks'}]

commit_message:
Adding exception handling when inspect_disks

It raises error even when live migration.
As live migration uses lock normally, it should not be an error.

Story: #2007651
Task: #39715

Change-Id: I3c0f29f79dc3c73e7aec9c9035c94c0fdcf8ccfd

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of mock

The mock third party library was needed for mock support in py2
runtimes. Since we now only support py36 and later, we can use the
standard lib unittest.mock module instead.

Change-Id: Iaf13c7dc3cf908d3755116ac861f732c220e324d

Add rabbitmq vhost to be used for sensu. Otherwise, there will be conflicts

Change-Id: Id298431eec53bfbc1db52db971e95fef1eb7e562
'}, {'created': '2017-08-01 14:00:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add sensu role

Add an ansible role to rollout sensu-server, sensu-api and sensu-client containers

Sensu clients will connect to sensu-server via the existing RabbitMQ cluster
and will subscripe to topics equal to the ansible groups the node part of. This
allows for granular targeting of subscription checks to only the nodes that
actually run the service.

This commit adds no checks, handlers, mutators or filters for Sensu but instead
enables the user to plug in his own

Sensu requires a separate RabbitMQ vhost to operate on due to conflicts
occurring with queues and exchanges created by OpenStack services

Add rabbitmq vhost to be used for sensu. Otherwise, there will be conflicts
with existing OpenStack services and Sensu subscription topics.

Change-Id: Id298431eec53bfbc1db52db971e95fef1eb7e562

Sensu clients will connect to sensu-server via the existing RabbitMQ
cluster and will subscribe to topics equal to the ansible groups the
node part of. This allows for granular targeting of subscription checks
to only the nodes that actually run the service.

This commit adds no checks, handlers, mutators or filters for Sensu but
instead enables the user to plug in his own

Sensu requires a separate RabbitMQ vhost to operate on due to conflicts
occurring with queues and exchanges created by OpenStack services

Add rabbitmq vhost to be used for sensu. Otherwise, there will be
conflicts with existing OpenStack services and Sensu subscription
topics.

commit_message:
Add sensu role

Add an ansible role to rollout sensu-server, sensu-api and sensu-client
containers

Sensu clients will connect to sensu-server via the existing RabbitMQ
cluster and will subscribe to topics equal to the ansible groups the
node part of. This allows for granular targeting of subscription checks
to only the nodes that actually run the service.

This commit adds no checks, handlers, mutators or filters for Sensu but
instead enables the user to plug in his own

Sensu requires a separate RabbitMQ vhost to operate on due to conflicts
occurring with queues and exchanges created by OpenStack services

Add rabbitmq vhost to be used for sensu. Otherwise, there will be
conflicts with existing OpenStack services and Sensu subscription
topics.

Change-Id: Id298431eec53bfbc1db52db971e95fef1eb7e562

commit_message:
Timing module not providing results "--timing"

when you add --timing args for any openstack command.
For example: openstack server list --timing.
it shows the table of results with only zeros output.

Change-Id: I35b1f0aefb32d23af9c2ca0231475a0b5d53799d
Closes-Bug: #1886955

subject: Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual
messages:
[{'account_id': 30356, 'date': '2020-07-12 03:25:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-07-12 03:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/739833'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-07-12 03:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/70/740570/1 : FAILURE'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-12 03:25:02.000000000', 'message': "Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I2f089d3398ecc621d28f333094e00fe5f0036831
"}]
commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

assertItemsEqual was removed from Python's unittest.TestCase in
Python 3.3 [1][2]. We have been able to use them since then, because
testtools required unittest2, which still included it. With testtools
removing Python 2.7 support [3][4], we will lose support for
assertItemsEqual, so we should switch to use assertCountEqual.

[1] - https://bugs.python.org/issue17866
[2] - https://hg.python.org/cpython/rev/d9921cb6e3cd
[3] - testing-cabal/testtools#286
[4] - testing-cabal/testtools#277

Change-Id: I2f089d3398ecc621d28f333094e00fe5f0036831

commit_message:
Test different users in same tenant can use same cephx id

This test uses two users user1 and user2 that are in the same tenant.
The test validates that different users in same tenant can use same
cephx id.

Change-Id: Ia8336604d0626dc9eea9c59ae96ffd865d2c70b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-16 15:46:35.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Raise useful error for invalid mempage size

The 'hw:mem_page_size' extra spec allows you to specify values in three
ways: via a relative size alias (large, small, any), via exact byte
values, and via an SI/IEC/mixed representation (e.g. 2MB, 1GB).
Currently, attempting to use an invalid variant of the latter, such as
'2M', will raise a rather confusing error message:

  Invalid memory page size '0'

Correct this so we instead see something like so:

  Invalid memory page size '2M'

Change-Id: I3af99f03514904da09f7b71f430b43bf75e8be67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879964
(cherry picked from commit f76d09b19d5b7530b7e4e9fc255835f6aff5db6a)
"}, {'created': '2020-06-17 01:14:32.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Raise useful error for invalid mempage size

The 'hw:mem_page_size' extra spec allows you to specify values in three
ways: via a relative size alias (large, small, any), via exact byte
values, and via an SI/IEC/mixed representation (e.g. 2MB, 1GB).
Currently, attempting to use an invalid variant of the latter, such as
'2M', will raise a rather confusing error message:

  Invalid memory page size '0'

Correct this so we instead see something like so:

  Invalid memory page size '2M'

Change-Id: I3af99f03514904da09f7b71f430b43bf75e8be67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879964
(cherry picked from commit f76d09b19d5b7530b7e4e9fc255835f6aff5db6a)

commit_message:
hardware: Raise useful error for invalid mempage size

The 'hw:mem_page_size' extra spec allows you to specify values in three
ways: via a relative size alias (large, small, any), via exact byte
values, and via an SI/IEC/mixed representation (e.g. 2MB, 1GB).
Currently, attempting to use an invalid variant of the latter, such as
'2M', will raise a rather confusing error message:

  Invalid memory page size '0'

Correct this so we instead see something like so:

  Invalid memory page size '2M'

Changes:
	nova/virt/hardware.py

NOTE(stephenfin): We need to drop use of 'raise...from', which is Python
3-only syntax. The net effect of this change is uglier (but still valid)
tracebacks.

Change-Id: I3af99f03514904da09f7b71f430b43bf75e8be67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879964
(cherry picked from commit f76d09b19d5b7530b7e4e9fc255835f6aff5db6a)
(cherry picked from commit eedc0b5ff319b3cce42dba4c4720bcb98798e064)

[{'created': '2020-07-01 11:06:08.000000000', 'message': 'Default volume_type set too early

If a volume_type is not specified in a volume-create request, change
I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091 (introduced in Train) sets a
default volume_type in the REST API layer.  This prevents the
selection logic in cinder.volume.flows.api.create_volume.
ExtractVolumeRequestTask from being able to infer the appropriate
volume_type from the source volume, snapshot, or image metadata, and
has caused a regression where the created volume is of the default
type instead of the inferred type.

This patch removes setting the default volume_type in the REST API
and modifies the selection code in ExtractVolumeRequestTask slightly
to make sure a volume_type is always assigned in that function, and
adds and revises some tests.

Change-Id: I05915f2e32b1229ad320cd1c5748de3d63183b91
Closes-bug: #1879578
(cherry picked from commit 674c8e7286999bb6408291de1dc6395aac2b04b1)

commit_message:
Default volume_type set too early

If a volume_type is not specified in a volume-create request, change
I4da0c13b5b3f8174a30b8557f968d6b9e641b091 (introduced in Train) sets a
default volume_type in the REST API layer.  This prevents the
selection logic in cinder.volume.flows.api.create_volume.
ExtractVolumeRequestTask from being able to infer the appropriate
volume_type from the source volume, snapshot, or image metadata, and
has caused a regression where the created volume is of the default
type instead of the inferred type.

This patch removes setting the default volume_type in the REST API
and modifies the selection code in ExtractVolumeRequestTask slightly
to make sure a volume_type is always assigned in that function, and
adds and revises some tests.

Change-Id: I05915f2e32b1229ad320cd1c5748de3d63183b91
Closes-bug: #1879578
(cherry picked from commit 674c8e7286999bb6408291de1dc6395aac2b04b1)
Conflicts:
  cinder/tests/unit/volume/flows/api/test_create_volume.py
  - cinder.tests.unit.test (victoria) -> cinder.test (pre-victoria)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-07 13:36:04.000000000', 'message': 'Don't set RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS

From the RabbitMQ docs[1]:

"RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS - Standard parameters for the erl command
used when invoking the RabbitMQ Server. This should be overridden for
debugging purposes only. Overriding this variable replaces the default
value."

We do not need any of the current values because of this commit from
2015 in rabbitmq 3.5.4:

https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/commit/5c3c0e6f38792ca37289888ce39996e6baf4d846

In which the "+K true" and "-kernel inet_default_connect_options
"[{nodelay,true}]" options were hard-coded to the rabbitmq-server
script.  Meanwhile the "+P 1048576" configuration was moved to the
rabbitmq-env script under the SERVER_ERL_ARGS variable, which is the
defaults used when RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS is unset.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/configure.html#supported-environment-variables

Let's also move the current RabbitAdditionalErlArgs to a new dedicated
override hiera key.

NB: To get this properly working we need a puppet-rabbitmq that contains
    https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/841
Depends-On: I3bf244a70538209773804eb85fae6be035c587f4

Closes-Bug: #1884922

Change-Id: I567839785a72813a382a00253562894e19eb6715
(cherry picked from commit 938166b93b8fc525d575c53509f8364a8f3d04e5)

commit_message:
Don't set RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS

From the RabbitMQ docs[1]:

"RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS - Standard parameters for the erl command
used when invoking the RabbitMQ Server. This should be overridden for
debugging purposes only. Overriding this variable replaces the default
value."

We do not need any of the current values because of this commit from
2015 in rabbitmq 3.5.4:

https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-server/commit/5c3c0e6f38792ca37289888ce39996e6baf4d846

In which the "+K true" and "-kernel inet_default_connect_options
"[{nodelay,true}]" options were hard-coded to the rabbitmq-server
script.  Meanwhile the "+P 1048576" configuration was moved to the
rabbitmq-env script under the SERVER_ERL_ARGS variable, which is the
defaults used when RABBITMQ_SERVER_ERL_ARGS is unset.

[1] https://www.rabbitmq.com/configure.html#supported-environment-variables

Let's also move the current RabbitAdditionalErlArgs to a new dedicated
override hiera key.

NB: To get this properly working we need a puppet-rabbitmq that contains
    https://github.com/voxpupuli/puppet-rabbitmq/pull/841
Depends-On: I3bf244a70538209773804eb85fae6be035c587f4

Closes-Bug: #1884922

Change-Id: I567839785a72813a382a00253562894e19eb6715
(cherry picked from commit 938166b93b8fc525d575c53509f8364a8f3d04e5)

commit_message:
Add delimiter for service image build example

Adds the \ line delimiter for the service image build example in
README.md. This prevents only half of the command being executed
if the example is copy pasted into a terminal.

Change-Id: Id04e8679a1979da9cd0a88e652465f915fd0bf28

commit_message:
hardware: Remove '_numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning'

This somewhat arbitrary split out is unnecessarily confusing,
particularly when it doesn't involve any complicated logic and the bulk
of the pinning-specific logic instead occurs in
'_pack_instance_onto_cores'. Fold it back into its caller.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Change-Id: Ia651cf9f51ff7265c5e3bfec79bc695aa3fe3394
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

On rax nodes, the voting LVM job fails
consistently because the test node is
rebooted midway [1]

While we debug the issue, lets disable
scenario tests for this job, temporarily
while we identify the root cause and fix
the issue.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1886988

Change-Id: Icd3706d5c73116a8e16166229736ae485bb2b5c0

commit_message:
[ci] Temporarily disable scenario tests

On rax nodes, the voting LVM job fails
consistently because the test node is
rebooted midway [1]

While we debug the issue, lets disable
scenario tests for this job, temporarily
while we identify the root cause and fix
the issue.

[1] https://launchpad.net/bugs/1886988

Change-Id: Icd3706d5c73116a8e16166229736ae485bb2b5c0
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Guard against missing image cache directory

The original fix of bug 1878024 missed an edge case where on a fresh
hypervisor the image cache directory hasn't been created yet. That
directory is only created when the first image is downloaded.

This patch makes sure that if the cache dir hasn't been created yet then
0 disk is reserved for the cache usage instead of raising and logging an
exception.

Change-Id: Id1bbc955a9099de1abc11b9063fe177896646d03
Related-Bug: #1878024
Closes-Bug: #1884214
(cherry picked from commit a85753778f710f03616a682d294f8f638dea6baf)
(cherry picked from commit a6a48e876c9c4f9a218de882270ef098d46bf767)
(cherry picked from commit f26823c7805c96d155de6837a08ec34271117515)

commit_message:
Add "isort" library to blacklist

"pylint" requires a class named "SortImports", not present in
"isort" versions >=5.0.0. Until "pylint" fixes this problem, we
should allow each projecty to install its own "isort" library
version to unblock CI pep8 jobs.

Change-Id: I158bcc8c249ad7ec981707c0d96ad8db87eb23d9
Related-Bug: #1886422
(cherry picked from commit be1dca06e04a68e6ad02f293369124d3c24875ba)

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886298
Bump the lower constraints for below deps which added python3.8 support
Markupsafe==1.1.1
cffi==1.14.0
greenlet==0.4.15
PyYAML==3.13

Story: #2007865
Task: #40200

Closes-Bug: #1886298

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I9857dc20057b97a2d0bae5b0b3410fa958bdc74f

[{'created': '2020-07-10 09:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failure with setuptools >= 49.0.0

Recent setuptools include updated vendored pkg_resource that changed
the exception that we need to expect from them. Leave in the old
version, too, for backwards compatibility.

(cherry picked from commit 83b781ae4f4c27c2857439bb02a8c2009a4ee87d)

commit_message:
Fix failure with setuptools >= 49.0.0

Recent setuptools include updated vendored pkg_resource that changed
the exception that we need to expect from them. Leave in the old
version, too, for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: I5bb01fb21982fb8757e925659ad206a15a79f799
(cherry picked from commit 83b781ae4f4c27c2857439bb02a8c2009a4ee87d)

commit_message:
Print warning message when connection running out

I believe when connection pool running out of available
resources, there will be all kinds of weird consequences
following. So let's print warning logs when we are going
to waiting indefinitely for the lock

Change-Id: I5ca930cada523bc77c644703a0f02b9160816231
Related-bug: #1871813
(cherry picked from commit 96300a32213d1a9bf114b90bef6971d69b839d1d)
(cherry picked from commit 39f770f55b3331b7a99b3ea42a34982a20635cf2)
(cherry picked from commit 1613b7a968f33ef7dc683d05fde05be0c458c8fc)

commit_message:
[Negative] Test different tenants cannot use same cephx id

This test uses two tenants (alt and primary) and uses one
cephx id. The test validates that a same cephx id can not
be used in different tenants.

Change-Id: I8dede49a32f432d05637e63177f9f5feae245adc

commit_message:
Install python-openvswitch from PyPI using requirements

This package is available in PyPI as "ovs".

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I1e4de27fa5e20308d778f1f3d55bc5fd9481bee8

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-07 09:28:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix docker_registry_namespace for RDO Phase1 promotion job

namespace tripleoussuri has been squatted on by another owner for ussuri
release. 'tripleou' namespace is used by TripleO-CI instead.

Change-Id: Ifc360f4cada70e75fe0b9c195024eef90c359413
"}]
commit_message:
Fix docker_registry_namespace for RDO Phase1 promotion job

namespace tripleoussuri has been squatted on by another owner for ussuri
release. 'tripleou' namespace is used by TripleO-CI instead.

Change-Id: Ifc360f4cada70e75fe0b9c195024eef90c359413
