commit_message:
Add missing security context to Keystone pods/containers

This updates the Keystone chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template.

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem flag to true

Change-Id: I334ef187a3dcaa082a5c3a7af63de4386dfbdf04

commit_message:
Cleanup zuul checks

This change moves the tungsten fabric check down to the periodic
checks with the other feature overrides, removes several duplicate
checks that are currently non-functional, and moves the rest to
experimental.

Also moves the compute-kit jobs back to using the default
single-node nodeset due to cloudedge going down and not
enough available 32gb nodes as a result

Change-Id: Ib4f314d5246af8756611346ed4919492d98510a5

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 01:04:59.000000000', 'message': "hardware: Raise useful error for invalid mempage size

The 'hw:mem_page_size' extra spec allows you to specify values in three
ways: via a relative size alias (large, small, any), via exact byte
values, and via an SI/IEC/mixed representation (e.g. 2MB, 1GB).
Currently, attempting to use an invalid variant of the latter, such as
'2M', will raise a rather confusing error message:

  Invalid memory page size '0'

Correct this so we instead see something like so:

  Invalid memory page size '2M'

Change-Id: I3af99f03514904da09f7b71f430b43bf75e8be67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879964
(cherry picked from commit f76d09b19d5b7530b7e4e9fc255835f6aff5db6a)
"}]
commit_message:
hardware: Raise useful error for invalid mempage size

The 'hw:mem_page_size' extra spec allows you to specify values in three
ways: via a relative size alias (large, small, any), via exact byte
values, and via an SI/IEC/mixed representation (e.g. 2MB, 1GB).
Currently, attempting to use an invalid variant of the latter, such as
'2M', will raise a rather confusing error message:

  Invalid memory page size '0'

Correct this so we instead see something like so:

  Invalid memory page size '2M'

Change-Id: I3af99f03514904da09f7b71f430b43bf75e8be67
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1879964
(cherry picked from commit f76d09b19d5b7530b7e4e9fc255835f6aff5db6a)

commit_message:
novajoin: install 'freeipa-client' on both Debian and Ubuntu

freeipa-admintools got merged into 'freeipa-client' before Debian
'buster'.

Ubuntu 'focal' does not have transitional package so let's fix name
before we switch to it.

Change-Id: I32f62a763b909da787dee1007055197d6a2dbce1

commit_message:
Add missing security context to Mini-mirror test pods/containers

This updates the mini-mirror chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template.

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem flag to true.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/740119/

Change-Id: I5a48b73a6a4530342bacead941128fdec7cc9c42

recheck'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-05-21 09:37:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I have a question related to this change.
In change [1] I'm trying to change a behavior for OVN localnet ports. Those are used to serve metadata answer and indirectly are used for DHCP (we use the fixed_ip address as `service_id` in OVN DHCP). 

In change [1] we try to allow IP allocation for such ports from different subnets linked to different segments, because in their nature those are distributed and we can allow those allocations.

My question here is if we delete segment_2, the corresponding DHCP port that has fixed IP allocation from segment_1 and segment_2 also will be deleted?



[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720464/"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-21 12:03:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I have a question related to this change.
 > In change [1] I'm trying to change a behavior for OVN localnet
 > ports. Those are used to serve metadata answer and indirectly are
 > used for DHCP (we use the fixed_ip address as `service_id` in OVN
 > DHCP).
 > 
 > In change [1] we try to allow IP allocation for such ports from
 > different subnets linked to different segments, because in their
 > nature those are distributed and we can allow those allocations.
 > 
 > My question here is if we delete segment_2, the corresponding DHCP
 > port that has fixed IP allocation from segment_1 and segment_2 also
 > will be deleted?
 > 
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/720464/

Hi Maciej,

Er, I'm not sure I fully understand the question. I feel like I may have a misunderstanding here. So let me spell out my assumptions and see if they were right or wrong:

A segment is a broadcast domain. DHCP relies on broadcast, therefore a dhcp port (i.e. a neutron port, not an ovs port) can serve a single segment. If I want to serve dhcp for a multi-segment network then I must have one dhcp port for each segment.

Let me have an example based on what I described in the bug report. I have a network with two segments. One segment using a physnet that's configured in sr-iov agent, the other segment using a physnet that's configured in ovs-agent. Since I only run a single dhcp-agent and that is configured with interface_driver=openvswitch I expect that I have dhcp only on the ovs segment in my network, but not on the sr-iov segment.

So what exactly is a dhcp port that has fixed-ip allocations from multiple segments? How can that work? What am I missing here?

I don't fully understand your change, but is it relaxing the model what I just described and allows a port to be present on multiple segments? In this case the port we're talking about is that a neutron port or an ovs port (or both)? Which segment is that port bound to?"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-21 15:05:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't fully understand your change, but is it relaxing the model
 > what I just described and allows a port to be present on multiple
 > segments? In this case the port we're talking about is that a
 > neutron port or an ovs port (or both)? Which segment is that port
 > bound to?

Reading your patch I'm starting to get it I guess. So ovn has this 'localport' concept which is a kind of distributed port, right? And in order to use that ovn feature from neutron your patch relaxes the 1:1 port:segment relationship, right?

I can't say I feel safe about this relaxation. If my change was the only place where we'd need to adapt this object model change, sure, I'll happily do that. But we had that 1:1 mapping for about 10 years and every single place in the code written having that assumption may now be broken.

For example with the trunk port feature the starting point was similar, that we realized the 1:1 port:network relationship had been a sub-optimal choice. But then to keep backwards compatibility we worked around that and never changed the 1:1 relation.

Just thinking out loud... What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-05-22 11:07:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Good patch, almost there.

I think you need to rebase it.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-05-22 11:14:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > I don't fully understand your change, but is it relaxing the
 > model
 > > what I just described and allows a port to be present on multiple
 > > segments? In this case the port we're talking about is that a
 > > neutron port or an ovs port (or both)? Which segment is that port
 > > bound to?
 > 
 > Reading your patch I'm starting to get it I guess. So ovn has this
 > 'localport' concept which is a kind of distributed port, right? And
 > in order to use that ovn feature from neutron your patch relaxes
 > the 1:1 port:segment relationship, right?
 > 
 > I can't say I feel safe about this relaxation. If my change was the
 > only place where we'd need to adapt this object model change, sure,
 > I'll happily do that. But we had that 1:1 mapping for about 10
 > years and every single place in the code written having that
 > assumption may now be broken.
 > 
 > For example with the trunk port feature the starting point was
 > similar, that we realized the 1:1 port:network relationship had
 > been a sub-optimal choice. But then to keep backwards compatibility
 > we worked around that and never changed the 1:1 relation.
 > 
 > Just thinking out loud... What do you think?

I think that you're right. We shouldn't change the rules here.

We shouldn't make this kind of exception for OVN, because we don't also know what the future will give us. Let me propose an update for my patch that will create a DHCP port *per* segment except allocation per segment."}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-22 15:46:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2020-05-22 16:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/729250/3 : FAILURE in 32m 50s'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2020-05-25 09:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > > I don't fully understand your change, but is it relaxing the
 > > model
 > > > what I just described and allows a port to be present on
 > multiple
 > > > segments? In this case the port we're talking about is that a
 > > > neutron port or an ovs port (or both)? Which segment is that
 > port
 > > > bound to?
 > >
 > > Reading your patch I'm starting to get it I guess. So ovn has
 > this
 > > 'localport' concept which is a kind of distributed port, right?
 > And
 > > in order to use that ovn feature from neutron your patch relaxes
 > > the 1:1 port:segment relationship, right?
 > >
 > > I can't say I feel safe about this relaxation. If my change was
 > the
 > > only place where we'd need to adapt this object model change,
 > sure,
 > > I'll happily do that. But we had that 1:1 mapping for about 10
 > > years and every single place in the code written having that
 > > assumption may now be broken.
 > >
 > > For example with the trunk port feature the starting point was
 > > similar, that we realized the 1:1 port:network relationship had
 > > been a sub-optimal choice. But then to keep backwards
 > compatibility
 > > we worked around that and never changed the 1:1 relation.
 > >
 > > Just thinking out loud... What do you think?
 > 
 > I think that you're right. We shouldn't change the rules here.
 > 
 > We shouldn't make this kind of exception for OVN, because we don't
 > also know what the future will give us. Let me propose an update
 > for my patch that will create a DHCP port *per* segment except
 > allocation per segment.

Hi all, sorry for jumping it a bit late.
I think that the concept of the distributed port in OVN is very cool for metadata is really cool and it'll save resources. (Also keep in mind that OVN doesn't need a port for DHCP but for metadata the owner will be 'dhcp'). Also I understand the concern brought up here but it seems reasonable to allow drivers decide if that constraint makes sense? 

While I agree that perhaps the 'if driver == 'ovn':' clause is not very nice in Neutron, can't we just defer the responsibility of deciding if such allocation is legit or not to drivers as it's implementation specific? What do you guys think?"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-25 14:51:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

> Hi all, sorry for jumping it a bit late.

Better late than never.

 > I think that the concept of the distributed port in OVN is very
 > cool for metadata is really cool and it'll save resources. (Also
 > keep in mind that OVN doesn't need a port for DHCP but for metadata
 > the owner will be 'dhcp'). Also I understand the concern brought up
 > here but it seems reasonable to allow drivers decide if that
 > constraint makes sense?

I understand ovn introduced a distributed port for good reason. My point is that this concept did not exist in neutron before and that may lead to code breaking. I see that Maciej's change got already +1-ed by zuul earlier, so we're not breaking existing tests. On the other hand how much multi-segment test coverage do we have? I'm afraid it's not much.

 > While I agree that perhaps the 'if driver == 'ovn':' clause is not
 > very nice in Neutron, can't we just defer the responsibility of
 > deciding if such allocation is legit or not to drivers as it's
 > implementation specific? What do you guys think?

Shouldn't the object model be independent of drivers? Don't we allow multiple mechanism drivers at the same time? Isn't this very change a proof that code outside of drivers have assumptions about the cardinality of the port-segment relation?"}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-25 14:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 15554, 'date': '2020-05-25 14:55:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That's a very good and valid point.

commit_message:
Auto-delete dhcp ports on segment delete

Subnet delete triggers dhcp port deletion but asynchronously,
therefore in the condition described in the bug report we may
get a conflict when deleting the segment too fast after the subnet.

Here we follow the example of how we auto-delete ports in net delete.

Please also find a fullstack test in Related-Change below.

Change-Id: Iba02f5a2211b18c2deb9097daad6be5e7d21faf8
Closes-Bug: #1878632
Related-Change: https://review.opendev.org/728904

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886296
Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/734700/

Story: #2007865
Task: #40180

Closes-Bug: #1886296
[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I482ac98bc56f0e3cfb8b767f47649da11ed1afab

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886296
Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40178

Closes-Bug: #1886296
[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/victoria/migrate-ci-cd-jobs-to-ubuntu-focal.html

Change-Id: I482ac98bc56f0e3cfb8b767f47649da11ed1afab

commit_message:
migrate testing to ubuntu focal

As per victoria cycle testing runtime and community goal[1]
we need to migrate upstream CI/CD to Ubuntu Focal(20.04).

Fixing:
- bug#1886296
Bump the pyflakes to 2.1.1 as min version to run pep8 jobs
on py3.8 which is default python vesion in ubuntu focal.

Story: #2007865
Task: #40178

Closes-Bug: #1886296

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-06-17 01:04:19.000000000', 'message': '[TRAIN ONLY] Provide way to initialize Leapp

The Leapp utility can require enabling extra repositories and
it must be provided with data [1] to perform in-place upgrade
from RHEL7 to RHEL8.

Example:
LeappInitCommand: |

commit_message:
[TRAIN ONLY] Provide way to initialize Leapp

The Leapp utility can require enabling extra repositories and
it must be provided with data [1] to perform in-place upgrade
from RHEL7 to RHEL8. We allow passing thsese with parameters
LeappRepoInitCommand and LeappInitCommand. To make sure most
users will not have to pass LeappInitCommand we sync the files
from Undercloud. Lastly we default the UpgradeLeappCommandOptions
to have default OSP16 repositories enabled forcing users to
either change this value or properly subscribe.

Example:
LeappRepoInitCommand: |
  subscription-manager repos --enable rhel-7-server-rpms
  subscription-manager repos --enable rhel-7-server-extras-rpms
LeappInitCommand: |
  sudo curl -4ksSL -o /etc/leapp/files/pes-events.json https://example.com/pes-events.json
  sudo curl -4ksSL -o /etc/leapp/files/repomap.csv https://example.com/repomap.csv

[1] - https://access.redhat.com/articles/3664871

Resolves: rhbz#1845726
Change-Id: Ibd57468623717273c29d473d32a76f37ae02fa31

subject: Ensure that certificates are correctly managed.
messages:
[{'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-07-09 08:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-07-09 09:47:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2020-07-09 12:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

1 typo in the commit message.

I think the fix is sound.

I was trying to find a way to functionally test this, however, Vault is unsealed during the `configure` lifecycle step in Zaza which means Keystone HA settles by that time.


What we could do is the following:

* deploy step: deploy vault, keystone and hacluster-keystone (1 keystone unit, no hacluster relation between keystone and hacluster-keystone, no certificates relation between Keystone and Vault);
* configure step: unseal vault (configure step);
* test step:
  * relate Keystone to Vault;
  * relate Keystone to hacluster-keystone.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-07-09 12:34:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 20805, 'date': '2020-07-09 18:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Note the func-full passed and patchset 2 was just a commit message change.
I have confirmed the patch addresses the bug.
Landing.'}, {'account_id': 20635, 'date': '2020-07-09 19:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-09 08:37:31.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that certificates are correctly managed.

When the certificates relation is ready before the
HA relation is clustered, the VIP symlinks will not
be created pointing at the correct certificates. This
change updates the HA handlers to ensure that the
certificate relation is handled after clustering,
if there are any certificate relations.

Change-Id: Idfbdaf7919569983cdf159e44a6dad26eccfd195
Cluses-Bug: #1886077
'}, {'created': '2020-07-09 12:34:31.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure that certificates are correctly managed.

When the certificates relation is ready before the
HA relation is clustered, the VIP symlinks will not
be created pointing at the correct certificates. This
change updates the HA handlers to ensure that the
certificate relation is handled after clustering,
if there are any certificate relations.

Change-Id: Idfbdaf7919569983cdf159e44a6dad26eccfd195
Closes-Bug: #1886077
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure that certificates are correctly managed.

When the certificates relation is ready before the
HA relation is clustered, the VIP symlinks will not
be created pointing at the correct certificates. This
change updates the HA handlers to ensure that the
certificate relation is handled after clustering,
if there are any certificate relations.

Change-Id: Idfbdaf7919569983cdf159e44a6dad26eccfd195
Closes-Bug: #1886077

commit_message:
use stevedore to load extensions

Importing pkg_resources causes the app to scan the entire import path
for all distributions, not just those providing entry points. The
scanner in stevedore will have a cache of the entry point data, making
it significantly faster. This will be especially useful in command
line programs like python-openstackclient.

Change-Id: Ic5eb9401c8ea3bd9624b818e0ffb8dcc13f61559
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Account for ironic bugfix branches

Per the new release model [1] ironic now has bugfix/X.Y branches.
This change applies the same gerrit ACL to these branches as to
the stable branches and updates the gerritbot.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/approved/new-release-model.html

Change-Id: Idfdbb616cd4274d8f483bf629c6e3f38e292d490

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Passing OS env vars
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I25e68fbc7f0586bba2248a5997ec5ea7b5b85c08

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718
Change-Id: I1c2c841b768671a1239fe287a45e71650ada5f32

the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Added bionic-stein test bundle as well
- Passing OS env vars instead of AMULET
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Icfd12f1ebe4797f5f22dff49680807b021828ac6

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- Removing unused import of AMULET env vars
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for bugfix/15.1

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as victoria branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5e4865f21ee368c801b2fbdb0fac6054ea8b7654

[{'created': '2020-07-08 09:27:58.000000000', 'message': "Add ensure-tox to novaclient-dsvm-functional

With the new base image tox is not installed anymore by defualt, thus
functional test job started to fail with tox command not found:

[..]/post_test_hook.sh:main:L40: sudo -E -H -u zuul tox -e functional
sudo: tox: command not found

This patch adds ensure-tox role to functional job's playbook.

Change-Id: I0e2c1895e50bc213f5346d8dc842c47519bacb99
"}]
commit_message:
Add ensure-tox to novaclient-dsvm-functional

With the new base image tox is not installed anymore by defualt, thus
functional test job started to fail with tox command not found:

[..]/post_test_hook.sh:main:L40: sudo -E -H -u zuul tox -e functional
sudo: tox: command not found

This patch adds ensure-tox role to functional job's playbook.

Change-Id: I0e2c1895e50bc213f5346d8dc842c47519bacb99

must be used to compile a policy file that can be distributed to

commit_message:
Fix policy configuration

Since cinder moved to policy-in-code, oslopolicy-policy-generator
must be used to compile a policy file that can be distributed to
Horizon for policy settings. For cinder, it will only output its
default policy unless cinder.conf contains an oslo_policy
configuration section pointing to the policy config file.

Change-Id: I66a76fdb30ae6afd8a8faf4119bef495600aec50
(cherry picked from commit dbaf649e0c3992f9ab6495ad2f8f55a0a97cd3ca)

commit_message:
Minor agent token log handling

Agent token heartbeat failures can return InvalidParameterValue
which was missed as an expected exception of the heartbeat action.

This change adds the exception to the expected list so
oslo_messaging doesn't generate a backtrace in the conductor log.

Change-Id: Ia3dd7bb19cbdc325acc8445c7308843067b51a2b

commit_message:
Extend transition_series.sh to submit reviews by team

This updates the EM transition script to process EM tagging by team and
submitting a review for each one so we don't have one large changeset to
process.

Change-Id: Ia48ccf5cdf5676ec7e9bd97e70b0b74592439820
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
